Job Posting: 177951 - Position: S26 Actuarial Intern 177951 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/12/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 02/03/2026 10:18 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country iA Financial Group (Industrial Alliance) 988 West Broadway Vancouver V5Z 1K7 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Actuarial Intern 177951 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 8 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List $30.00 and $34.00 CAD per hour Employer: iA Financial Group Office: 988 Broadway West Location: Vancouver, British Columbia Other Possible Location(s): Toronto, Ontario • Job category: Internships and Student Employment Job ID: JR10024811 Job type: Student Job Apply before: February 13, 2026 Description Build the future with us Are you driven by numbers and eager to contribute to the purpose of a company that helps its clients feel confident and secure about their future? As an Actuarial Co-op Student, you will play a key role in supporting actuarial teams and gaining hands-on experience in financial analysis and reporting. This position is a great opportunity to showcase your skills and fully realize your potential within a caring and trustworthy company. Here, people and their development are at the heart of our priorities, fostering an environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. What you'll accomplish with us As an Actuarial Co-op Student, you'll be at the core of our mission. Here are the main responsibilities: • Participate in month-end and quarter-end valuation activities, including running reserves and updating spreadsheets for earnings analysis. • Conduct actuarial analyses and assist with gains and losses reviews. • Support special projects such as profitability studies and trend analysis. • Assist with the production of various reports by gathering and organizing required information. Respond to data requests and provide technical support to actuarial analysts and advisors. • Why you'll love working with us • A work environment where learning and development merge with a collective pursuit of excellence. • A healthy, safe, fair, and inclusive environment where potential can be freely expressed and developed. • The opportunity to work in a hybrid environment, supported by flexibility and access to inspiring and innovative workspaces. • Benefits for students: access to internal training, mentoring, involvement in real projects, flexible schedules adapted to studies, and a valuable experience to enhance your professional journey. Apply now and get ahead of your career, where your talent really belongs! Still unsure about applying? At iA, we believe in potential and value diverse experiences. If this role inspires you, go ahead and apply - your place might be with us, and we want to get to know you! For positions posted in British Columbia: The typical hiring range for this position is between $30.00 and $34.00 CAD per hour; the base salary offered may vary depending on knowledge, skills, years of experience, and internal equity related to the role. At iA, we are committed to offering a fair, equitable, and market-based compensation structure. Our market data is updated annually to reflect the most current market conditions. Job Requirements What could accelerate your success in this role We're looking for someone who: • Is known for their strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Stands out for their attention to detail and ability to follow established procedures. • Demonstrates proficiency in Excel, Access, Python, and R (GLMs, tidyverse). • Is recognized for their ability to manipulate large data sets and familiarity with SQL. • Has previous office experience and exceptional verbal and written communication skills. • Is currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in actuarial science. • Asset: Knowledge of IFRS 17 and/or AXIS. Availability: Full-time for 8 months, flexible start date. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://ia.ca/en/carrieres/job/JR10024811 Application Deadline: February 13, 2026 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
